snippet: Rebels gave up their demand for President François Bozizé to step down in exchange for the release of political prisoners and the forming of a coalition government.
abstract: Central African Republic government and rebel fighters seeking to oust Pres Francois Bozize sign deal for weeklong cease-fire that could mature into peace plan.

byline.contributor: Christian Panika contributed reporting from Bangui, Central African Republic.

lead_paragraph: Rebels gave up their demand for President François Bozizé to step down in exchange for the release of political prisoners and the forming of a coalition government.

headline.seo: Rebels Agree to Cease-Fire in Central African Republic
headline.main: Rebel Coalition in Central African Republic Agrees to a Short Cease-Fire
headline.print_headline: Rebel Coalition in Central African Republic Agrees to a Short Cease-Fire
